{{cpp/error/error_code/title|operator bool}}
{{cpp/error/error_code/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++11|1=
explicit operator bool() const noexcept;
}}

Checks if the error code value is valid, i.e. non-zero.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
{{c|false}} if {{c|1=value() == 0}}, {{c|true}} otherwise.

===Notes===
Although this operator is often used as a convenient shorthand to check if any error was returned, as in {{c|if (ec) { /* handle error */ }&lt;!----&gt;}}, such use is not robust: some error codes, for example, HTTP status code {{c|200}}, may indicate success as well.
